0.85.text:
Today I'm going to see the Queen at
Buckingham Palace to mark the

5.49.text:
And that will be the start of what is the
most important

8.59.text:
General Election campaign in a
generation. When I became Prime Minister

13.38.text:
five years ago, this country was on the
brink.

16.43.text:
Millions were out of work, family budgets
were badly squeezed,

20.67.text:
the economy was in real difficulty and
people worrying whether this country

26.04.text:
Five years on we haven't solved every
problem,

29.18.text:
but the deficits down, the country's
getting back to work,

32.22.text:
we're growing strongly. We are a success
story again

35.56.text: and we should stick to the plan that has really delivered.

39.13.text: This election is a big choice, either

42.44.text:
I will come back to Downing Street and carry
on with the plan

45.63.text:
that's turning the country round and funding our
public services

48.78.text:
or Ed Miliband will walk into Downing
Street with more debt,

52.37.text:
more spending, more taxes -  all the things
that got this country

56.37.text:
into a mess in the first place. I'm going to
be campaigning

59.57.text:
as hard as I possibly can over these
next few weeks

63.10.text:
to make sure we stick to the plan that's
delivering

66.22.text:
security for Britain, but more to the
point, for you

69.92.text: your family and for your children's future
